Class EasyStreetGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • view.EasyStreetGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class EasyStreetGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The graphical user interface for the EasyStreet program.
    Version:
    Autumn 2014
    Author:
    Marty Stepp, Daniel M. Zimmerman, Alan Fowler (acfowler@u.washington.edu)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      A notification method called in response to action events in this window.
      private void advanceAnimation()
      Advances the simulation by one frame of animation, moving each vehicle once and checking collisions.

      Draws debugging information, if necessary.

      Draws the city map with the specified Graphics2D object.

      Draws dotted lines on streets.

      Generates a read-only neighbors map for the specified vehicle.
      private void initGUI()
      Sets up the GUI.
      private boolean isValidIndex(int theY, int theX)
      Tests whether the square at the given x/y position exists on the map.

      Returns a new JButton with the specified text.

      Reads the grid portion of the map file.

      Reads the vehicle portion of the map file.
      private void reset()
      Resets all the vehicles to their initial locations, resets the tick counter, and stops the simulation.

      Sets the paint color appropriately for the current lights.

        Tests whether the square at the given x/y position exists on the map.
        Parameters:
        theX - The x position.
        theY - The y position.
        Returns:
        true if the position exists on the map, false otherwise.
